Envisioning an Equitable Future

PWUFSD recently welcomed New York State United Teachers (NYSUT) during its “Fund Our Future” bus tour to bring attention to the lack of funding from the state and its implications on the district. Superintendent of Schools Dr. Michael Hynes; State Senator Anna Kaplan; members of the Board of Education, Parent Council, and Port Washington Teachers Association; and district employees gathered for a round table discussion in the library of Weber Middle School to emphasize Port’s diverse community and its effect on the needs of students in the district. The conversation also focused on mental health and social-emotional learning for the district’s growing student body. Together, the district emphasized its relative success working with its limited resources as well as the challenges of meeting all students’ needs with limited state funding. This event was in support of Port’s continuous fight to receive its fair share of state aid and receive the $20 million from the past five years. #FundOurFuture #PortPride #EducationalExcellence

Dr. Hynes’ commitment to an educational philosophy built around educating the whole child and his reputation for community engagement will build and expand upon the wonderful foundation established by Dr. Kathleen Mooney. #PortPride #EducationExcellence

No Place for Hate in PWUFSD

Paul D. Schreiber High School and Carrie Palmer Weber Middle School have been named “No Place for Hate” schools for the fourth and second consecutive years, respectively, by the Anti-Defamation League’s No Place for Hate education initiative. This honor is bestowed upon schools who have a proven record of initiatives—workshops, assembly programs, guest speakers and school-wide culture—that promote tolerance, acceptance and anti-bullying behavior. #PortPride #EducationExcellence

One Step Closer

Congratulations to Daly’s second grade students who recently participated in Fun Run, a fundraising event to help Alex’s Lemonade Stand Foundation move one ‘step’ closer to finding a cure for all children with cancer.

The hallways were full of chants and laughter as the second graders tied the laces of their running sneakers and geared up to fundraise. With the support of their classmates and parents, students walked throughout each hallway on the three levels in the building. For every lap completed, local sponsors donated 25 cents to benefit pediatric cancer through Alex’s Lemonade Stand Foundation. Each student aimed to raise $5 dollars towards the building’s goal of $400. Collectively, Daly’s second graders raised a culmination of $516.50 so far to donate to pediatric cancer! Way to go, Daly Stars! #PortPride #EducationExcellence

Guggenheim Elementary School Celebrates New Expansion

The Board of Education; district administration; Guggenheim administrators, teachers, and students; together with the Guggenheim community recently gathered for a ribbon cutting ceremony to officially introduce the newly constructed space at Guggenheim Elementary School. The ceremony officially opened three new classrooms; six small classrooms for special area teachers; an Enrichment, Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, Mathematics (ESTEAM) lab; a multi-purpose room; two offices for storage of musical instruments and two restrooms. Beginning in September 2019, the space will be used in full capacity! #PortPride #EducationExcellence

Manorhaven Gets Moving!

Congratulations to Manorhaven Elementary School for earning 1st place in Nassau County for the 5th Annual New York State (NYS) Association for Health, Physical Education, Recreation and Dance (AHPERD) Get Moving Video Contest!

The building’s physical education teachers—also members of NYS AHPERD—collaborated with students to develop and submit a video that showcases building initiatives for students to “get moving” during gym class and features different exercises and programs implemented throughout the district’s elementary level following NYS Learning Standards for Health and Physical Education. NYS AHPERD awarded $2,000 worth of Flaghouse physical orientation equipment to Manorhaven for earning first place. Way to go, Manorhaven! #PortPride #EducationExcellence
